eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Provision of signed informed consent prior to any study specific procedures

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Male or female, aged ≥18 years at the time of consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HFrEF Diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Established documented diagnosis of symptomatic HFrEF (New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional class II-IV), which has been present for at least 2 months and is optimally treated with pharmacological and/or device therapy, as indicated. NB: Patients in which additional pharmacological or device therapy is contemplated, or should be considered, must not be enrolled until therapy has been optimized and is stable for ≥1 month.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: LVEF Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≤40% (echocardiogram, radionuclide ventriculogram, contrast angiography or cardiac MRI ) within the last 12 months prior to enrolment (Visit 1): - If there is more than one assessment of LVEF the value from the most recent measurement should be used in assessing eligibility - Patients undergoing coronary revascularization (percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) or coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG)), valve repair/replacement or implantation of a cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device or any other surgical, device or pharmacological intervention (ie initiation of a beta-blocker) that might improve LVEF must have a measurement of LVEF at least 3 months after the intervention in order to be eligible. NB: Patients with known HFrEF but without a recent (≤12 months) assessment of left ventricular (LV) function will undergo a local echocardiogram at the time of enrolment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: NT-proBNP Levels
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: N-terminal pro b-type natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP) >600 pg/ml (or if hospitalised for heart failure within the previous 12 months, NT-proBNP ≥400 pg/ml) at enrolment (visit 1). - If concomitant atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter at Visit 1, NT-proBNP must be ≥900 pg/ml (irrespective of history of heart failure hospitalisation)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Standard of Care Therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients should receive background standard of care for HFrEF and be treated according to locally recognized guidelines with both drugs and devices, as appropriate. Guideline-recommended medications should be used at recommended doses unless contraindicated or not tolerated. Therapy should have been individually optimized and stable for ≥4 weeks (this does not apply to diuretics – see NB below) before visit 1 and include (unless contraindicated or not tolerated): - an ACE inhibitor, or ARB or sacubitril/valsartan and - a beta-blocker and - if considered appropriate by the patient’s treating physician; a mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist (MRA). NB: Most patients with heart failure require treatment with a diuretic to control sodium and water retention leading to volume overload. It is recognized that diuretic dosing may be titrated to symptoms, signs, weight and other information and may thus vary. Each patient should, however, be treated with a diuretic regimen aimed at achieving optimal fluid/volume status for that individual.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: eGFR Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: eGFR ≥30 ml/min/1.73 m2 (CKD-EPI formula) at enrolment (visit 1)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: SGLT2 Inhibitor Therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Receiving therapy with an SGLT2 inhibitor within 8 weeks prior to enrolment or previous intolerance of an SGLT2 inhibitor

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Type 1 Diabetes
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1D)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hypotension
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Symptomatic hypotension or systolic BP <95 mmHg at 2 out of 3 measurements either at visit 1 or visit 2.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Acute Decompensated HF
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Current acute decompensated HF or hospitalisation due to decompensated HF <4 weeks prior to enrolment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent CV Events
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: MI, unstable angina, stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 12 weeks prior to enrolment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent Revascularization
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Coronary revascularization (percutaneous coronary intervention [PCI] or coronary artery bypass grafting [CABG]) or valvular repair/replacement within 12 weeks prior to enrolment or planned to undergo any of these operations after randomisation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: CRT Implantation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Implantation of a CRT within 12 weeks prior to enrolment or intent to implant a CRT device

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Cardiac Transplant or VAD
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous cardiac transplantation or implantation of a ventricular assistance device (VAD) or similar device, or implantation expected after randomisation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Specific Cardiomyopathies
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: HF due to restrictive cardiomyopathy, active myocarditis, constrictive pericarditis, hypertrophic (obstructive) cardiomyopathy or uncorrected primary valvular disease

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Bradycardia or Heart Block
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Symptomatic bradycardia or second or third degree heart block without a pacemaker

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Life Expectancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any condition outside the CV and renal disease area, such as but not limited to malignancy, with a life expectancy of less than 2 years based on investigator´s clinical judgement

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Malignancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active malignancy requiring treatment at the time of visit 1(with the exception of successfully treated basal cell or treated squamous cell carcinoma)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatic Impairment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hepatic impairment (aspartate transaminase [AST] or alanine transaminase [ALT] >3x the upper limit of normal [ULN]; or total bilirubin >2x ULN at time of enrolment). An isolated increase in bilirubin in patients with known Gilbert’s syndrome is not a reason for exclusion.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Blood-borne Diseases
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known blood-borne diseases such as specified in Appendix B (category A and B)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Severe Renal Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Severe (eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by CKD-EPI), unstable or rapidly progressing renal disease at the time of randomisation

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception and Pregnancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Women of child-bearing potential (i.e., those who are not chemically or surgically sterilised or who are not post-menopausal) who are not willing to use a medically accepted method of contraception that is considered reliable in the judgment of the investigator, from the time of signing the informed consent throughout the study and 4 weeks thereafter, OR women who have a positive pregnancy test at enrolment or randomisation OR women who are breast-feeding

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Study Involvement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Involvement in the planning and/or conduct of the study (applies to both AstraZeneca personnel and/or personnel at the study site)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous Randomisation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous randomisation in the present study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Clinical Study
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participation in another clinical study with an IP during the last month prior to enrolment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Inability to Comply
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Inability of the patient, in the opinion of the investigator, to understand and/or comply with study medications, procedures and/or follow-up OR any conditions that, in the opinion of the investigator, may render the patient unable to complete the study. NB: Patients who cannot complete the electronic patient reported outcome (ePRO) assessments can still participate in the study.
